title: Fronti and Ozuna Bring Unfiltered Heat on â€˜Un Kiss (Remix)â€™ â€” and an OrangeÂ Lamborghini
summary: This Latin Remix of the Week delivers an explosive dose of uncensored trap.
body: In our Latin Remix of the Week series, we spotlight remixes that the  Billboard  Latin and  Billboard EspaÃ±ol  editors deem to be exceptional and distinct from the rest. We might not publish a review every week. This is our selection today. Fronti, one of Puerto Ricoâ€™s rising voices in mÃºsica urbana, enlists superstar Ozuna for the remix of his track â€œUn Kiss,â€ originally featured on his 2025 album El Diamond . While the original, produced by Dime Ecua and Arkey-O, showcased Fronti’s streetwise charisma, the remix amplifies the energy with Ozunaâ€™s sly hooks. Backed by sleek trap production from RKO, the song finds Fronti spitting blunt verses about unfiltered desire, while Ozunaâ€™s pre-chorus and hook add a playful yet polished contrast. â€œ Dale, bebÃ©, dame un kiss pa’ que lubri, vamoâ€™ a romper la ley, â€ Ozuna croons. The chemistry between the two artists infuses the track with a feverish momentum. The music video sees the two artists flexing their star vibes and lyrical prowess, decked out in flashy jewelry and grills, set against neon-lit backdrops and an orange Lamborghini. Itâ€™s a fitting visual complement to a track brimming with luâ€¦

title: Clarentâ€™s Ambitious EP â€˜No Vuelve a Sucederâ€™ & More Best New MusicÂ Latin
summary: Plus, check out Billboard's New Music Latin weekly playlist below!
body: New Music Latin is a compilation of the best new Latin songs and albums recommended by Billboard Latin and Billboard EspaÃ±ol editors. Check out this weekâ€™s picks below. Xavi & Carin LeÃ³n, “La Morrita” (Socios Music) “La Morritaâ€ (the young lady) has entered the chat, thanks to Xavi and CarÃ­n LeÃ³n’s first collaborative effort. Produced by Edgar Barrera, and co-written by Barrera, Xavi, CarÃ­n, alongside Alex HernÃ¡ndez, Fabio GutiÃ©rrez, and Luis Mexia, the track finds the two Mexican forces delivering a vibrant, high-octane huapango that sets the stage for a bold love confession. With a cheeky and playful spirit, Xavi and CarÃ­n not only breathe new life into the traditional huapango rhythm, but they also sing about modern-day romanticism: “I sent her flowers and a [HermÃ¨s] Kelly bag because she has a boyfriend and I want people to know/ That I like to spoil her, the young lady is really pretty,” goes the lyrics. â€” INGRID FAJARDO Clarent, No Vuelve a Suceder (De Baller/Warner Music Latina) Clarent is staking his claim this 2026, delivering a 10-track EP that feels like a statement of intent â€” raw, unapologetic, and fiercely self-assured. The risâ€¦

title: Megan Moroney Reveals Some Famous Names Are Joining Her on New Album â€˜CloudÂ 9â€™
summary: The set, the country star's third, comes out in February.
body: Megan Moroney has some famous friends joining her on Cloud 9 , her third full-length album arriving Feb. 20 on Sony Music Nashville/Columbia Records. Related Megan Moroney Announces Dates For 2026 International The Cloud 9 Tour Megan Moroney Describes Her Status With Morgan Wallen Three Years After Their Split Megan Moroney Talks Inspiration Behind ‘Cloud 9’ & CMA Nominations | CMA Awards 2025 The emo cowgirlâ€™s new 15-track set will feature collaborations with Ed Sheeran on â€œI Only Miss Youâ€ and Kacey Musgraves on â€œBells & Whistles.â€ Moroney announced the tracklisting Friday (Jan. 9) via a short video that featured her emerging from a small biplane in pink boots and pink flight suit before segueing to the song titles skywritten against a sky blue background. The album includes the previously released â€œ6 Months Later,â€ which is No. 6 on Billboardâ€™s Country Airplay chart dated Jan. 10, and â€œBeautiful Things,â€ which is at No. 32. Moroney co-wrote every song on the album and worked with such top Nashville songwriters as Luke Laird, Jessie Jo Dillon, ERNEST, Jessi Alexander, Hillary Lindsey and Emily Weisbard and MacKenzie Carpenter.  Sheeran is â€¦

summary: Great Britain's Kirsty Muir claims a third World Cup victory of her career by winning the Freeski Slopestyle event at the US Grand Prix in Aspen on Friday.

title: Kim Kardashian Has High Praise for a Ye Design: â€˜Thereâ€™s Nothing Likeâ€™ This FashionÂ Item
summary: "I donâ€™t know if they ever made these or just made them for me," the reality mogul said.
body: Kim Kardashian gave some major props to her ex-husband Ye (formerly Kanye West ) during her recent trip to Aspen, Colo., to kick off the new year. Related Kanye West and Kim Kardashian’s Relationship: A Timeline A Timeline of the Consequences Ye Has Faced for His ‘WLM’ Shirts & Antisemitic Hate Speech Ray J Has â€˜No Doubtâ€™ the Kardashians Are Racketeers â€“ And Says ChatGPT Agrees Kim K. recently posted a TikTok style video recapping her chic, wintery look while going out for a night in the popular ski destination town. The reality mogul rocked Roberto Cavalli leather pants with a golden corset and a luxe fur coat. She paired her outfit with Yeezy boot heels to complete the look , which perfectly matched her magenta pants. After paying the Yeezy design a compliment in the video, she said she wasn’t sure if the boots ever hit retail shelves or were a special custom design for just her. “Then I put it with these Yeezy boots,” Kim said. “I will say, thereâ€™s nothing like a Yeezy heel. I donâ€™t know if they ever made these or just made them for me. I love when a shoe is tonal to the pant.” @kimkardashian Aspen Styling Vlog â€¦

title: Ariana Grande in â€˜Home Aloneâ€™: See What It Really Took to Pull Off One of the Most Elaborate â€˜SNLâ€™ SketchesÂ Yet
summary: It's also definitely one of the show's most violent sketches.
body: Ariana Grande was all for getting splattered with as much blood as possible for Saturday Night Live ‘s spoof on Home Alone in December — but that was just one of many elaborate special effects the crew had to pull off to get everything just right. Related Ariana Grande Hosts ‘SNL’ for the Third Time: All 9 Sketches Ranked Ariana Grande Reimagines Iconic ‘Home Alone’ Scene With a Gory Twist in ‘SNL’ Parody: Watch Ariana Grande Spoofs Mariah Carey’s ‘All I Want for Christmas Is You’ in ‘SNL’ Monologue: Watch Thanks to a behind-the-scenes video from the set of the sketch shoot posted Thursday (Jan. 8), fans get to see the lengths to which the pop star and SNL ‘s cast and crew had to go in order to nail the tribute. First of all, the costumes had to be just right, with Grande morphing into Home Alone ‘s Kevin McCallister in a perfect blonde wig and custom-sewn robe. Other cast members were dressed to look exactly like Kevin’s family. But while the cameramen and director Mike Diva had to work nonstop to construct detailed replicas of the Home Alone house and recreate the exact timiâ€¦

title: â€˜Billy Joel: And So It Goes,â€™ â€˜The Wizard of Oz at Sphereâ€™ & More Nominated for 2026 PGA Awards: FullÂ List
summary: KPop Demon Hunters, Zootopia 2 and Only Murders in the Building are also among the nominees.
body: The Producers Guild of America has announced the nominees for the 37th Annual Producers Guild Awards. The awards will be presented on Saturday, Feb. 28, at the Fairmont Century Plaza in Los Angeles. Related Sphere’s ‘Wizard of Oz’ Hits New Box Office Milestone How Movies Make Music Fans: Billy Joel Documentary Shows How the Right Film Can Win New Audiences How ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Changed the Game For Netflix Nominees for the ceremonyâ€™s top honor, the Darryl F. Zanuck Award for Outstanding Producer of Theatrical Motion Pictures, are Bugonia, F1, Frankenstein, Hamnet, Marty Supreme, One Battle After Another, Sentimental Value , Sinners, Train Dreams and Weapons. The winner in this category has historically correlated closely with the Oscar winner for best picture. Billy Joel: And So It Goes, an acclaimed look at legendary Piano Man Billy Joel , is vying for outstanding producer of non-fiction television with aka Charlie Sheen, Mr. Scorsese, Pee-wee as Himself and SNL50: Beyond Saturday Night. KPop Demon Hunters, the megahit Netflix film that spawned one of the yearâ€™s biggest hits, HUNTR/Xâ€™s â€œGolden,â€ is nominated for outstanding producerâ€¦

title: â€˜Frierenâ€™ Logs Third Consecutive Week at No. 1 on Billboard Japan Book HotÂ 100
summary: Following at No. 2 is In the Megachurch by Ryo Asai, lifting from No. 13 last week.
body: Vol. 15 of Soso no Frieren ( Frieren: Beyond Journeyâ€™s End ) by Kanehito Yamada and Tsukasa Abe keeps at No. 1 on Billboard Japanâ€™s Book Hot 100, on the chart released Jan. 8. The Japan Book Hot 100 is a comprehensive list combining physical sales, e-books, library loans, subscription data, and social media activity. Soso no Frieren ( Frieren: Beyond Journeyâ€™s End ) Vol. 15 leads both physical-store sales and e-books and is at No. 14 for EC this week, holding the top spot for the third consecutive week.  Related ‘Frieren’ Stays at No. 1 for Second Week on Billboard Japan Book Hot 100 Watch Earl Sweatshirt Deliver Pizzas in Hilarious Ad for His Collab With Local LA Shop Skye Newman Fends Off Sombr, Geese & More to Be Crowned BBC's Sound Of 2026 Winner Following at No. 2 is In the Megachurch by Ryo Asai, lifting from No. 13 last week. Told from the perspectives of three characters and centered on the culture of â€œoshi-katsu,â€ or fan activity, the novel drew increased attention through year-end roundups by bookstores and individual readers. Buzz was further fueled by the 36-year-old authorâ€™s appearance on TV Asahiâ€™s Reiwa Roman no Goraku Gatari , which aâ€¦

title: â€˜There is Immense Potentialâ€™: Amid Maduro Turmoil, What Is the Future of Venezuelaâ€™s MusicÂ Industry?
summary: Rawayana's Beto Montenegro and two Venezuelan music executives answer five business questions about the future of the industry amid major recent events.
body: The music industry in Venezuela â€” like other sectors â€” has suffered a notable decline in recent decades due to the country’s economic crisis, as well as the emigration of talent, insecurity and political censorship or self-censorship. Once a strategic destination for the touring market because of its geographic location, Venezuela has been largely excluded from the travel schedules of major international stars in recent years, although in 2024 there was a brief resurgence with concerts by artists like Maluma , Karol G and Luis Miguel . Related Carlos Baute, Danny Ocean, Ricardo Montaner & More React to U.S. Capture of NicolÃ¡s Maduro: ‘All Profound Changes Are Painful’ Maya J'an Signs With Warner Records: Debut Single is a Powerful 'Love Letter' to Hometown After L.A. Fires Kennedy Center President to 'Seek $1 Million in Damages' From Jazz Musician Who Called Off Christmas Eve Show But that mini-boom took a hit after the disputed presidential elections of July 28 that year, when the Venezuelan electoral authority declared NicolÃ¡s Maduro the winner with 51.2% of the vote (although it has not shown proper documentation that support â€¦

title: Drake Calls Out â€˜People Who Look Up toâ€™ Him as Wait for â€˜Icemanâ€™ Continues
summary: Will 2026 be the year of the Iceman?
body: The Iceman appears to be defrosting. Drake delivered a cryptic message of disappointment via an Instagram carousel early Friday (Jan. 9) for those who admire him. Related Looking Ahead: A Release Calendar of Upcoming Albums in 2026 Drake Accused of Funding Fake Spotify Streams in Latest Gambling Lawsuit From Justin Bieber to Drake, Big Sean Breaks Down His Favorite Features of All Time “I was expecting people who look up to me to look me in the eyes too I thought thatâ€™s the least they could do,” he wrote in what sounds like a possible bar off his next album. “But I was wrong about them like I was wrong about you.” The photo dump is filled with more mysterious messages that could be tied to Iceman , as it always feels like there’s something deeper to decode with Drizzy’s posts. “It’s time to move on, isn’t it?” one slide reads. There are a couple of photos of Drake hanging with his old friend and college football phenom, Johnny “Football” Manziel. He gives a hat-tip to author Fran Lebowitz with a funny message about life and exacting revenge. “I have two main activities in life. Smoking andâ€¦

title: Flight Engineers Give NASAâ€™s Dragonfly Lift
summary: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s mostâ€¦
body: In sending a car-sized rotorcraft to explore Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, NASAâ€™s Dragonfly mission will undertake an unprecedented voyage of scientific discovery. And the work to ensure that this first-of-its-kind project can fulfill its ambitious exploration vision is underway in some of the nationâ€™s most advanced space simulation and testing laboratories. From left, Johns Hopkins APL engineers Tyler Radomsky and Felipe Ruiz install a rotor on the Dragonfly test model at the Transonic Dynamics Tunnel at NASAâ€™s Langley Research Center in Virginia. NASA Set for launch in in 2028, the Dragonfly rotorcraft is being designed and built at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) in Laurel, Maryland, with contributions from organizations around the world. On arrival in 2034, Dragonfly will exploit Titan’s dense atmosphere and low gravity to fly to dozens of locations, exploring varied environments from organic equatorial dunes to an impact crater where liquid water and complex organic materials essential to life (at least as we know it) may have existed together. Aerodynamic testing When full rotorcraft integration and testing begins in February, the team will tap into a trove oâ€¦

title: I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds
summary: As booster manager for NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynoldsâ€™ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttleâ€™s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy,â€¦
body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dave Reynolds Dave Reynolds, the booster manager for SLS (Space Launch System), works inside the Next Generation Booster Avionics Mockup at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. Reynolds is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boosters for the rocket that carry NASAâ€™s Orion spacecraft and astronauts to the Moon as part of the Artemis II mission. Credits: NASA As booster manager for NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynoldsâ€™ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttleâ€™s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. Growing up in Roy, Utah, Reynolds remembers standing outside to watch the billowing smoke rise from booster tests at Northrop Grummanâ€™s Promontory facility. Rockets were the backdrop of his childhood, and growing up during the shuttle missions sparked his fascination for space exploration. As the booster manager for the SLS, Dave is responsible for the design, development, and flight of the boostersâ€”work that echoes the sense of significance that inspired him as a child to study spaâ€¦

body: 6 min read NASAâ€™s Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat) , as NASA innovates with ambitious science missions that take low-cost, creative approaches to answering questions like, â€œHow does the universe work?â€ and â€œAre we alone?â€ All three missions are set to launch Jan. 11 on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Space Launch Complex 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. The launch window opens at 8:19 a.m. EST (5:19 a.m. PST). SpaceX will livestream the event. Artistâ€™s concept of NASAâ€™s Pandora mission, which will help scientists untangle the signals from the atmospheres of exoplanets â€” worlds beyond our solar system â€” and their stars. NASAâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center/Conceptual Image Lab Download high-resolution images from NASA’s Scientific Visualization Studio â€œPandoraâ€™s goal is to disentangle the atmospheric signals of planâ€¦

summary: Low clouds blanketed the delta while parallel cloud bands rolled over the Bay of Bengal during a January cold wave.

This image shows low-lying clouds over the delta on the morning of January 6, captured by the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) on NASAâ€™s Terra satellite. Dense fog, particularly radiation fog , is common this time of year, forming when ground temperatures are cool, winds are light, and moisture is abundant near the surface. The meteorological departments of both Bangladesh and India called for moderate to very dense fog over the region that day amid anâ€¦

title: NASA to Provide Media with International Space Station Update Today
summary: NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agencyâ€™s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medicalâ€¦
body: Credit: NASA NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agencyâ€™s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and its crew. On Jan. 7, the agency announced it was postponing a planned spacewalk originally scheduled for Jan. 8 while teams monitored a medical concern with a crew member currently living and working aboard the orbital laboratory. The matter involved a single crew member, who is stable . Due to medical privacy, it is not appropriate for NASA to share more details about the crew member. Participants in the news conference include: NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman Amit Kshatriya, associate administrator Dr. James Polk, chief health and medical officer, NASA Headquarters NASA will provide live coverage of the news conference on NASA+ , Amazon Prime , and the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel . Learn how to stream NASA content through a variety of online platforms, including social media. To participate in the news conference virtually or in-person, media must RSVP for details no later than one hour before the start of the event to the NASA Newsroom at: hq-media@mail.nasa.gov . NASAâ€™s media credentialing policy is online. To lâ€¦

title: NASA Starts Up Gatewayâ€™s Power System for First Time
summary: Development continues on NASAâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can prâ€¦
body: 1 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The primary structure of Gatewayâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element (PPE) undergoing assembly, integration, and testing at Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, on September 29, 2025. Lanteris Space Systems Development continues on NASAâ€™s Power and Propulsion Element, a solar electric propulsion spacecraft designed to provide power for Gateway in lunar orbit. Able to generate 60 kilowatts of power, the element was successfully powered on earlier last year. The milestone demonstrates the element can provide the spacecraft with power, high-rate communications, attitude control, as well as the ability to maintain and maneuver between orbits. The Power and Propulsion Element is managed by NASAâ€™s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland and built by industry partner Lanteris Space Systems in Palo Alto, California, where teams have secured the elementâ€™s main electrical system inside protective exterior panels. On deck for installation at Lanteris Space Systems are three 12-kilowatt advanced electric propulsion system thrusters, manufactured by L3Harris, and four 6-kilowatt Busek-built BHT-6000 thrusters. title: Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A Blue
summary: After a four-decade run, the massive, waterlogged berg is leaking meltwater and on the verge of disintegrating.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23Aâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us December 26, 2025 The year that iceberg A-23A first broke away from Antarcticaâ€™s Filchner Ice Shelf , Ronald Reagan was president of the United States, and the movie Top Gun was setting box office records. Forty years later, the massive tabular bergâ€”one of the largest and longest-lived bergs ever tracked by scientistsâ€”is sopping with blue meltwater and on the verge of complete disintegration as it drifts in the South Atlantic between the eastern tip of South America and South Georgia island. When it first detached from Antarctica in 1986, the berg was nearly twice the size of Rhode Islandâ€”about 4,000 square kilometers. Estimates from the U.S. National Ice Center put the bergâ€™s area at 1,182 squaâ€¦

title: 'Whoever signed off England's tour has to go' - Agnew column
summary: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

title: Carey hits four to seal five-wicket win for Australia
summary: Alex Carey secures victory in style for Australia, as he hits a four to seal a five-wicket win against England on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney, as Australia win the series 4-1.

title: 'He's a yard short!' - Labuschagne run out as England show late fight
summary: Marnus Labuschagne is run out for 37 after some excellent fielding from Matthew Potts as Australia fall to 121-5, chasing 160 to win on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'That has spun a mile' - Smith stunned by brilliant Jacks delivery
summary: Australia captain Steve Smith is left stunned as he's bowled by a brilliant delivery from Will Jacks for 12, leaving Australia on 92-3, needing 68 runs to win the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'It's had a shocker' - Snicko controversy strikes England again
summary: England find themselves on the wrong side of another controversial Snicko decision after Jake Weatherald is given not out despite there appearing to be a murmur on the Snicko technology, as the ball passes the bat - with Weatherald on 16 and Australia 33-0, chasing 160 to win the fifth and final Asâ€¦

title: Rumoured Solskjaer return to Man Utd 'seems ridiculous'
summary: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Stephen Warnock look at who should take charge at Manchester United following Ruben Amorim's departure earlier this week.

title: 'A wonderful innings' - Bethell's brilliant knock ended by Starc
summary: Jacob Bethell's memorable innings comes to an end as he's caught for 154 by Alex Carey, off the bowling of Mitchell Starc to leave England 328-9, with a lead of 146 on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Defensively, we are more stable than ever - Guardiola
summary: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is pleased with his side's defensive performance highlighting Max Alleyne as "exceptional" in their 1-1 draw at home to Brighton.

title: 25 Years in Orbit: Science, Innovation, and the Future of Exploration
summary: NASA and its partners have supported humans continuously living and working in space since November 2000. A truly global endeavor, the International Space Station has been visited by more than 290 people from 26 countries and a variety of international and commercial spacecraft. The unique micrograâ€¦
body: NASA astronaut Jasmin Moghbeli retrieves media bags inside the International Space Station’s Kibo laboratory module for Emory University’s Project EAGLE investigation. NASA NASA and its partners have supported humans continuously living and working in space since November 2000. A truly global endeavor, the International Space Station has been visited by more than 290 people from 26 countries and a variety of international and commercial spacecraft. The unique microgravity laboratory has hosted more than 4,000 experiments from over 5,000 researchers from 110 countries. The space station also is facilitating the growth of a commercial market in low Earth orbit for research, technology development, and crew and cargo transportation.  After a quarter of century of human presence in orbit, the station remains a symbol of international cooperation and a proving ground for humanityâ€™s next giant leaps to the Moon and, eventually, Mars.   September’s full Moon, the Harvest Moon, is photographed from the space station, placed in between exterior station hardware. NASA The microgravity environments aboard the space station unlocks discoveries that benefit lifâ€¦
